title: Recognizing handwritten text
proctitle: CHI '91: Proceedings of the SIGCHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems

references.text: Alien, R. B. Connectionist language users. Connection Science, 2(4), 1990.
Badie, K. and Shimura, M. Machine recognition of roman cursive scripts. 1982, pp. 28-30.
Brown, M. K. and Ganapathy, S. Cursive script recognition. Fifth International Conference on Character Recognition, 1980, pp. 47-51.
Buell, B. and Brandt, R. The pen: Computing's next big leap. Business Week, May 14, 1990.
Derthick, M. The minimum description length principle applied to feature learning and analogical mapping. MCC technical report ACT-CYC-234-90, 1990.
Earnest, L. D. Machine recognition of cursive writing. Information Processing 1962. Amsterdam: North Holland, 1963, pp. 462-466.
Eden, M. Handwriting and pattern recognition. IRE Translations on Information Theory, February, 1962, pp. 160-166.
Eden, M. and Halle, M. The characterization of cursive writing. In C. Cherry (ed.), Proceedings of the Fourth London Symposium on Information Theory. London, England: Butterworths, 1961, pp. 287-299.
Ehrich, R. W. and Koehler, K.J. Experiments in the contextual recognition of cursive script. IEEE Transactions on Computers, Vol C-24 (2), February, 1975.
Frishkopf, L. S. and Harmon, L. D. Machine reading of cursive script. In C. Cherry (ed.), Proceedings of the Fourth London Symposium on Information Theory, London: Butterworth, 1961, pp 300-315.
Guyon, I., Albrecht, P., LeCun, Y., Denker, J., and Hubbard, W. Design of a neural network character recognizer for a touch terminal. Pattern Recognition, 24(2), 1991.

Hinton, G. E. Learning distributed representations of concepts. Proceedings of the Eighth Annual Conference of The Cognitive Science Society, Amherst, Massachusetts: Lawrence Erlbaum Associates, 1986.

Hinton, G. E., McClelland, J. L., and Rumelhart, D. E. Distributed representations. In D. E. Rumelhart and J. L. McClelland (eds.), Parallel Distributed Processing. Cambridge, Massachusetts: The MIT Press, 1986.

LeCun, Y. Boser, B., Denker, J. S., Henderson, D., Howard, R. E., Hubbard, W., and Jackel, L. D. Handwritten digit recognition with a back-propagation network. In Touretzky, D. S., (ed.)Neural Information Processing Systems 2, Morgan Kaufmann, 1990.
Martin, G. L. Using neural networks to recognize hand-drawn symbols. MCC technical report ACT-HI- 232-90, 1990.
Martin, G. L. Integrating segmentation and recognition stages for overlapping hand-printed characters. MCC technical report ACT -NN -3 20 -9 0.
Martin, G. L., Leow, W. K., and Pittman, J. A. Function complexity effects on back-propagation learning. MCC technical report ACT-HI-062-90, 1990.

Martin, G. L. and Pittman J. A. Recognizing handprinted letters and digits. In Touretzky, D. S., (ed.) Neural information Processing Systems 2, Morgan Kaufmann, 1990. Also available as MCC technical report ACA-HI-017-90.
Martin, G. L. and Pittman J. A. Recognizing handprinted letters and digits using backpropagation learning. Neural Computation, 3(2), 1991, in press.
Martin, G. L., Pittman, J. A., Wittenburg, K., Cohen, R., and Parish, T. Sign here, Please. BYTE, July, 1990, 243-251. Also available as MCC technical report ACT-HI- 199-90.

McClelland, J. L and Kawamoto, A.H. Mechanisms of sentence processing: Assigning roles to constituents. In D. E. Rumelhart and J. L. McClelland (eds.), Parallel Distributed Processing. Cambridge, Massachusetts: The MIT Press, 1986.
Mori, Y. and Joe, K. A large-scale neural network which recognizes handwritten Kanji characters. In Touretzky, D. S., (ed.) Neural information Processing Systems 2, Morgan Kaufmann, 1990.
Pollack, J. and Waltz, D. L. Interpretation of natural language. Byte, February, 1986.

Rumelhart, D. E., Hinton, G. E., and Williams, R. J. Learning internal representations by error propagation. In D. E. Rumelhart and J. L. McClelland (eds.), Parallel Distributed Processing. Cambridge, Massachusetts: The MIT Press, 1986.

Rumelhart, D. E. and McClelland, j.L. On learning the past tenses of English verbs. In D. E. Rumelhart and J. L. McClelland (eds.), Parallel Distributed Processing. Cambridge, Massachusetts: The MIT Press, 1986.
Sejnowski, T. J. and Rosenberg, C.R. NetTalk: A parallel network that learns to read aloud. Johns Hopkins University Electrical Engineering and Computer Science technical report JHU/EECS-86/01, 1986.
Sexton, T. Go's PenPoint redefines handwriting recognition. PC Week, August 20, 1990.
Shannon, C. E. Prediction and entropy of printed English. Bell Systems Technical Journal, Vol 30, January, 1951.
Shannon, C. E. and Weaver, W. The Mathematical Theory of Communication. Urbana, Illinois: University of Illinois Press, 1963, p. 13.
Talley, j. Personal communication. 1989.
Tappert, C. C. Cursive script recognition by elastic matching. IBM Journal of Research and Development, November, 1982, 26(6), 765-771.

Tappert, C. C., Suen, C. Y., and Wakahara, T. The state of the art in on-line handwriting recognition. IEEE Transactions on Pattern Analysis and Machine Intelligence, 12(8), August, 1990, pp. 787-808.
Touretzky, D. S. and Derthick, M. A. Symbol processing in connectionist networks" Five properties and two architectures. Proceedings of the IEEE Spring COMP-CON87, San Francisco, 1987.
Touretzky, D. S. and Elvgren, G. Rule representation in a connectionist chunker. In Touretzky, D. S., (ed.) Neural Information Processing Systems 2, Morgan Kaufmann, 1990.

Touretzky, D. S. and Geva, S. A distributed connectionist representation for concept structures. Proceedings of the Ninth Annual Conference of The Cognitive Science Society, Seattle, Washington: Lawrence Erlbaum Associates, 1987.
Ward, R.R. Annotated bibliography of topics relating to on-line handwriting input. Lowell, Massachusetts" Computer Annotation Technologies Group, Wang Laboratories.
Wieland, A. and Leighton, R. Shaping schedules as a method for accelerated learning. Proceedings of the First International Neural Network Society Conference, 1988.
Zachary P. G. Computer firms see the writing on the screen. Wall Street Journal, April 30, 1990.
